RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 1 5F Dirt CR: 94. Claiming Purse 13000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 14, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KING OF THE COURT stalked the early leaders while racing mid pack, was asked at the half mile pole and responded with a good turn of foot, made his move as he pleased in the stretch and drew off for the win. GLENN'S JUMPER was hesitant to load, broke hsarp, sent for the early lead, took control of the race early while setting the pace from the rail, but then faded at the sixteenth pole and had to settle for second place today. LET IT B vied for the early lead, settled into a stalking position was in contention but had no late kick. WONDER RUN showed little. HUG THE MUNNY was never involved.

ENTRY.NAME: Glenn's Jumper
ENTRY.COMMENT: was hesitant to load, sent, led, faded, second best today

ENTRY.NAME: King of the Court
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, asked at the 1/2, took control mid stretch, drew off

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: W. Bruce Lunsford & Hill 'n' Dale Farm

ENTRY.NAME: Hug the Munny
ENTRY.OWNER: Day Perry and Foster Joseph M

ENTRY.NAME: Let It B
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, stalked from off the pace, was in contention, no kick

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 2 5F Dirt CR: 82. Claiming Purse 15000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 14 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs. (If deemed inadvisable by management to ru n this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at Five Furlongs) (Rail at 20 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STREET ART vied for the early lead, was encouraged to set the pace and show the way, saved ground while racing along the fence, was in control past the quarter pole but failed to switch leads and tired in the3 stretch. PREMIUM vied for the early lead but settled just off the pace into a stalking position while racing in the three path, was well placed but when asked lacked response. AHIMAAZ broke to the outside, was corrected and settled into the four path as he stalked the early leaders, was driven and kept to task through the turn, while still racing wide, was encouraged and pushed down the stretch closed in on the early leaders and collared them after the sixteenth pole while drifting out, ut was able to get up in time and take the win. MARKETBOOK was pushed out at the start by an inside rival, was allowed to settle off the pace and find his stride, was asked to gain ground and responded well while closing in on the early leaders, launched a late bid but was passed by an outside rival but was still up for second. THIRSTY WIND off slow, never involved. BUTWAITTHERE'SMORE was no menace. JUDGMENTAL showed little.

ENTRY.NAME: Street Art
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, pace, rail, did not switch leads, tired late

ENTRY.NAME: Premium
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, smartly settled just off the pace, stalked, 3w, no latekick

ENTRY.NAME: Ahimaaz
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward break, 5w, rated, driven, drifted out late but up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Marketbook
ENTRY.COMMENT: pushed out start, settled in hands, 5w, closed, battled, 2ndbest

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 63. Maiden Special Weight Purse 30000. For Accredited La Bred Maidens, Three Years Old and Upward Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.(Preference To Horses That Have Not Started For A Claiming Price Of Less Than $25,000).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: REDDINGANDLEE was off a bit slow and settled off the pace, raced in the three and four paths as he found his stride and patiently waited for the cue to launch his bid, waited through the turn and the then edged out into the five path in the upper stretch where he launched a winning bid, was driven down the lane and collared the early leaders and take the win. SWIFT CUSTOM stalked the early leaders at first, was pushed to gain ground and improved position by the half mile marker, was encouraged to launch an all out bid at the seven sixteenth pole, took control and lead into the stretch where he was caught late by a fast closing outside rival. SPARKIN forwardly placed, tired. JERSEY BE GOOD was sent out of the gates with the intention of taking the lead and controlling the pace, raced along the rail while showing the way, was encouraged strongly at the five sixteenth marker, was cued to switch leads and faltered. C P'S WILD FIRE broke in at the start and was never involved. AFTER JERSEY BE GOOD CROSSED THE WIRE HE WAS PULLED UP AND VANNED OFF.

ENTRY.NAME: C P's Wild Fire
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward start, saved ground, never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Reddingandlee
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, settled off the pace, bid 1/4, 5wupper, closed,upforwin

ENTRY.NAME: Swift Custom
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, gained ground 1/2, launched bit 7-16th, caught late

ENTRY.NAME: Jersey Be Good
ENTRY.COMMENT: sent out of the gates, lead, pace, rail, pushed 5-16th, faltered

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 4 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 60. Claiming Purse 14000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CARLOS PUNCH stalked the early pace setters while racing in the four path in the second tier early on, raced in a set with another rival while stalking, edged out at the five sixteenth pole and into the upper stretch to find racing room, settled on the three path in the stretch, launched a bid, ended up racing in between foes in a four way battle at the sixteenth pole, shook two of the challengers, raced on to the wire battling the last outside challenger and just out finished this challenger at the wire. OURQUICKDRAWMCGRAW settled of the pace while racing in the nine path, was encouraged to improve position by the three eighths pole, edged into the four path and continued to gain ground, was in contention at the quarter pole, battled to the sixteenth pole with three other rivals, shook two of the challengers, raced on to the wire battling an inside foe and was out finished today while still running a game race and took second place honors. GTUONE BUCK raced in the second tier on the outside in the five path, edged out at the five sixteenth pole, shifted closer to the rai in the upper stretch, was asked but lacked response and finished flat. CUSTOM CRESCENT showed brief speed early and raced even. LONE STAR MAX was off a bit slow and never got involved. CHIEFWEAVE raced mid pack ,from the seven path and had no impact. LIT A SHUCK vied for and took the early lead, showed the way from the rail, then tired after the quarter pole. TOOCAN DANCE showed little. A CROWN FOR BEAU broke a touch slow and trailed through out.

ENTRY.NAME: Gtuone Buck
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2nd tier, 5w, edged out 5-16th, no late bid

ENTRY.NAME: Carlos Punch
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 4w, 2nd tier, 3wupper,in btwn late, battled, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Ourquickdrawmcgraw
ENTRY.OWNER: Salome Robert Joseph and Salome Dana
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 9w, improved position 3/8, battled stretch, second best

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 5 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 59. Maiden Claiming Purse 12000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at 1 Mile and 70 Ya rds) (Rail at 20 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LAYLA'S SONG settled in the first turn, found her stride and took command by the half mile marker and was never challenged, much the best today. MISS ARKANSAS raced from far off the pace along the rail, was allowed to rate at a comfortable pace until the half mile pole where she was asked to launch a bid and she responded well by steadily gaining ground and momentum with every stride, was in contention at the quarter pole but had to much ground between her and the eventual winner to make up today but still ran a game second. MARK WITH AN E brief speed, faded. GOTTEMINABIND briefly stalked the early leader, then made no impact. PENNIE'S MAGIC was never involved.

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Arkansas
ENTRY.COMMENT: far off the pace, rail, closed, one run ,up for second

ENTRY.NAME: Layla's Song
ENTRY.OWNER: Johnson Kenneth W and Woodson Clinton J
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 1st turn, took command 1/2, drew off, much the best

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 59. Maiden Special Weight Purse 30000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Preference To Horses That Have Not Started For A Claiming Price Of Less Than $25,000).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CERTIFIED GEM vied for the early lead, attended to the pace, was an uncontested winner. QUEEN OF THE MOON raced off the pace, improved position and gained ground at every pole, closed strong and raced gamely. BITSY PERFECTMATCH stalked early and faded late. YOCKEY BETTERFLY raced mid pack, from in between horses, was well placed but had no late kick. BEULAH K no impact. KISSTER raced off the pace, ended up in between horses going into the stretch, and improved position late. NOT ALONE showed little. CLEARANCE SALE was never involved. EVERYLITTLESINGH showed brief speed, stalked the paces setters and tired. LONG SHOT LOUISE was no menace.

ENTRY.NAME: Yockey Betterfly
ENTRY.OWNER: Whitley Ranch and Racing LLC and Whitley Ray
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, in between, lacked late response

ENTRY.NAME: Bitsy Perfectmatch
ENTRY.OWNER: Reeves Kathy Eleven One Racing Stables LLC and Joe Hackler Racing LP

ENTRY.NAME: Queen of the Moon
ENTRY.COMMENT: raced off the pace, gained ground steadily, up for second.

ENTRY.NAME: Certified Gem
ENTRY.OWNER: Tri-Star Racing LLC and Joey Foster Racing & Farm LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, set the pace, uncontested, game

ENTRY.NAME: Kisster
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, in between, slight improvement late.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 18500. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 14 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MO BELLA vied for the early lead, took command of the pace, showed the way from the fence, and was an easy winner. DREAM TOWN stalked the eventual winner while maintained position. VIOLA STAR saved ground, closed after the half mile marker, and was able to get up for third. CUSTOM MAIDEN made no impact. PAT HAND GIRL trailed early and improved her position late. KENYA STRIKE was no factor. TWN MS MIDSHIP raced mid pack while saving ground along the rail, then tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Viola Star
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, closed, up for third

ENTRY.NAME: Mo Bella
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied , led, rail trip, easy winner

ENTRY.NAME: Pat Hand Girl
ENTRY.OWNER: Harden Patricia M and Hargrave Randall

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 8 5F Dirt CR: 85. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 28000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $15,000. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since April 14, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at Five Furlongs) (Rail at 20 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HE'S A BOMB wire to wire. D TWO left the gates a bit tardy, was allowed to settle and race from off the pace, was asked and responded with a grand turn of foot at the quarter pole and was able to claim second place honors. MCLEAN made no impact. SPECIAL BREED stalked, the early pace, then faltered late. PEPPER JACK trailed through out.

ENTRY.NAME: D Two
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, allowed to settle, one late run, up for second
